net.minecraft.src.forge

Interface IItemRenderer


  • public interface IItemRenderer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean handleRenderType(ItemStack item, ItemRenderType type)
      Checks if this renderer should handle a specific item's render type
      void renderEntityItem(RenderBlocks render, EntityItem item)
      Called to render an in-world item, e.g. one that has been thrown or dropped.
      void renderEquippedItem(RenderBlocks render, EntityLiving entity, ItemStack item)
      Called to render an item currently held in-hand by a living entity.
      boolean renderEquippedItemAsBlock(ItemStack item)
      Determines if the currently equipped item should be rendered as a 3D block or as a 2D texture.
      void renderInventoryItem(RenderBlocks render, ItemStack item)
      Called to render an item in a GUI inventory slot.
      boolean renderInventoryItemAsBlock(ItemStack item)
      Determines if the item should be rendered in GUI inventory slots as a 3D block or as a 2D texture.
      boolean useEntityItemBobbingEffect(ItemStack item)
      Determines if an up-and-down bobbing effect should be used when rendering an EntityItem, like all default blocks and items do.
      boolean useEntityItemRotationEffect(ItemStack item)
      Determines if a rotation effect should be used when rendering an EntityItem, like most default blocks do.

    • Method Detail

      • handleRenderType

        boolean handleRenderType(ItemStack item,
                         ItemRenderType type)
        Checks if this renderer should handle a specific item's render type
        Parameters:
        item - The item we are trying to render
        type - A render type to check if this renderer handles
        Returns:
        true if this renderer should handle the given render type, otherwise false

      • renderEntityItem

        void renderEntityItem(RenderBlocks render,
                      EntityItem item)
        Called to render an in-world item, e.g. one that has been thrown or dropped. The appropriate OpenGL transformations and scaling have already been applied, so Tessellator location (0,0,0) is the center of the EntityItem.
        Parameters:
        render - The RenderBlocks instance
        item - The in-world item to be rendered

      • useEntityItemRotationEffect

        boolean useEntityItemRotationEffect(ItemStack item)
        Determines if a rotation effect should be used when rendering an EntityItem, like most default blocks do.
        Parameters:
        item - the item we are trying to render
        Returns:
        true if the EntityItem should rotate, otherwise false

      • useEntityItemBobbingEffect

        boolean useEntityItemBobbingEffect(ItemStack item)
        Determines if an up-and-down bobbing effect should be used when rendering an EntityItem, like all default blocks and items do.
        Parameters:
        item - the item we are trying to render
        Returns:
        true if the EntityItem should bob up and down, otherwise false

      • renderEquippedItem

        void renderEquippedItem(RenderBlocks render,
                        EntityLiving entity,
                        ItemStack item)
        Called to render an item currently held in-hand by a living entity. If rendering as a 3D block, the item will be rotated to a 45-degree angle. To render a 2D texture with some thickness (like default items), see net.minecraft.src.ItemRenderer. In either case, rendering should be done in local coordinates from (0,0,0)-(1,1,1).
        Parameters:
        render - The RenderBlocks instance
        entity - The entity holding this item
        item - The equipped item to be rendered

      • renderEquippedItemAsBlock

        boolean renderEquippedItemAsBlock(ItemStack item)
        Determines if the currently equipped item should be rendered as a 3D block or as a 2D texture.
        Parameters:
        item - the item we are trying to render
        Returns:
        true if the equipped item should be rendered as a 3D block, otherwise false

      • renderInventoryItem

        void renderInventoryItem(RenderBlocks render,
                         ItemStack item)
        Called to render an item in a GUI inventory slot. If rendering as a 3D block, the appropriate OpenGL translations and scaling have already been applied, and the rendering should be done in local coordinates from (0,0,0)-(1,1,1). If rendering as a 2D texture, the rendering should be in GUI pixel coordinates from (0, 0, 0)-(16, 16, 0).
        Parameters:
        render - The RenderBlocks instance
        item - The item stack to render

      • renderInventoryItemAsBlock

        boolean renderInventoryItemAsBlock(ItemStack item)
        Determines if the item should be rendered in GUI inventory slots as a 3D block or as a 2D texture.
        Parameters:
        item - the item we are trying to render
        Returns:
        true if the inventory item should be rendered as a 3D block, otherwise false
